ygData.subject: Re: Name suggestions
ygData.msgSnippet: But the guild is in the game, not in real life.  If the guild is based in a real-life qualities and not on the game and role-playing then all we need to do is
ygData.messageBody:
But the guild is in the game, not in real life. If the guild is based in
a real-life qualities and not on the game and role-playing then all we
need to do is writte each others names down and grou if we see each other
:) By creating a guild name/charter that fits both role-playing AND
non-roleplaying styles we can include everyone, which is what i've been
trying to do, but I tihnk i've just made things really complicated and
sour so i guess I will bow out of this discussion now, see you in EQ!!!!:)

-joe

On Thu, 29 Jul 1999, Christina Norman wrote:

> From: Christina Norman <tina@...>
>
>
> I don't actually believe that name and charted need to be directly
> related. I don't believe that the name must imply the charter, though it
> can. I also don't believe our guild necessarily requires an intense, role
> playing, charter. We're all drawn together because we're LGBT, not
> because beyond that we share the same focus or interests in terms of role
> playing style.
>
> - Christina
>
> On Thu, 29 Jul 1999, Joseph Normandin wrote:
>
> > From: Joseph Normandin <josephn@...>
> >
> > I think you have some good ideas here but i would like to know what you
> > would want our "charter" to say with all these different names. the
> > charter is going to be just as important as the name...what would they be
> > in these cases?
> >
> > -joe
> >
>
>
